projects.Title: 1 - Introductory Course
projects.Description: An introduction to the principles of web design, web development, and to techniques on collaboration and work sharing, which will support the continuation of all other projects in the program.

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what HTML, CSS and Javascript are

Skills.Skill: Be able to use a code editor (create code files, save them)
Be able to install and use supporting tools for the code editor
Be able to create quick code prototypes online
Be able to use Git for code hosting and versioning
Be able to write a document in Markdown format

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what a code editor is

Skills.Skill: Be able to setup a development environment to start a web development project
Be able to use HTML and CSS to create a simple website
Be able to use the browser's development tools to inspect a website's code
Be able to publish a static website

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what a markup language is
Understand what a style sheet language is
Understand what the "cascading" in Cascading Style Sheets means

Skills.Skill: Be able to create any layout with the tools available in CSS
Be able to create a logo
Be able to create  a mood board
Be able to create a UI by creating sketches, wireframes, finally prototypes
Be able to create a style guide

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a mood board
Understand what is a user interface
Understand what is Wireframing and Prototyping
Understand what is a style guide

Skills.Skill: Be able to write an article

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is Scrum and its components
Understand what is Kanban and its components

Competences.Competence: To be ready to collaborate effectively with peers in order to achieve a common goal
To be ready to learn and apply new technologies independently
To be ready to exhibit the results of a collaborative work

projects.Title: 2 - Community & Networking
projects.Description: Integration into the communities that revolve around activities related to the development of the web such as universities, development, design and marketing agencies, open source and other coding communities, conferences and online forums. To accomplish that the student will dedicate time to engage in different activities that have the potential to strengthen their participation in the web industry.

Competences.Competence: To be ready to integrate the community of professionals in web

projects.Title: 3 - The fundamentals
projects.Description: Students learn about the fundamental aspects of Javascript programming and become capable of creating dynamic web applications. Creation of concise, clear, well-written code and the conception of a great User Experience are some important goals in this project.

Skills.Skill: Be able to create a responsive website
Be able to use CSS Flexbox and CSS Grid to create responsiveness
Be able to create animations with CSS

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand the mechanisms CSS offers to animate

Skills.Skill: Be able to create and style a form
Be able to use HTML5 native validation for forms

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand how forms work in HTML

Skills.Skill: Be able to create Sass code and compile it into CSS
Be able to "watch" files with Sass
Be able to learn and use a front-end/UI framework
Be able to use variables and other basic constructs of Javascript
Be able to do operators with different data types in Javascript

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a programming language
Understand how can Javascript work with and without the browser

Skills.Skill: Be able to execute conditional statements in Javascript
Be able to use loops and iterators to create lists

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what are loops and iterators

Skills.Skill: Be able to use functions in Javascript

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what are functions, parameters, return values and related concepts

Skills.Skill: Be able to make use of ES6 features
Be able to transpile ES6 code

guides.Title: Javascript In The Browser - DOM Manipulation & Timing

Skills.Skill: Be able to select elements form the DOM and change them with Javascript
Be able to iterate through collections of DOM elements
Be able to add event listeners to DOM elements
Be able to create animations by manipulating element classes
Be able to create a timer for a an action

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand why the DOM is only available in browsers
Understand the timing functions in Javascript

Skills.Skill: Be able to create a form that gets processed by Javascript when submitted
Be able to create proper validation for forms and display the errors to the user

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand the importance of validating forms

guides.Title: Javascript In The Browser - Common Web APIs

Skills.Skill: Be able to use the location and history Web APIs
Be able to use the localStorage Web APIs
Be able to create a SPA with pure Javascript

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a Web API
Understand how to get information about Web APIs
Understand what is a Single Page Application (SPA)

Skills.Skill: Be able to define a set of actions to improve the UX of a project
Be able to create a Navigation and  Information Architecture plan for a simple project
Be able to demonstrate an interaction design plan
Be able to pair program
Be able to write a Technical Article

product_development.Title: Dynamic Web Application made with vanilla Javascript

Competences.Competence: To be ready to collaborate effectively with peers in order to achieve a common goal
To be ready to learn and apply new technologies independently
To be ready to exhibit the results of a collaborative work

projects.Title: 4 - Connecting to the World
projects.Description: Students learn about important aspects concerning the connectivity of a web application, while getting in touch with more advanced concepts and tools and developing a robust technical vocabulary. At the same time, knowledge is built about how to improve the chances of creating something that real people will have an easy time using.

Skills.Skill: Be able to write a technical article

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand the basics about Internet architecture
Understand what is HTTP and DNS
Understand what is a Web Server
Understand the difference between traditional web hosting and cloud computing

Skills.Skill: Be able to use JSON to transport data across different systems
Be able to use the fetch API in Javascript
Be able to use Promises in Javascript
Be able to use Async functions in Javascript
Be able to debug Javascript code using both the console and VSCode (or similar)

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is the client-server architecture

Skills.Skill: Be able to create code using the Functional programming paradigm

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a programming paradigm

guides.Title: Javascript - Modules, Package Managers and Bundlers

Skills.Skill: Be able to use a package manager such as npm
Be able to bundle a code base

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a package manager

Skills.Skill: Be able to create test units for Javascript code
Be able to use Typescript
Be able to create a React application
Be able to use state management in React

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a Javascript Framework

Skills.Skill: Be able to create a simple UX testing plan

product_development.Title: A web application which focuses on connectivity and interactivity

Competences.Competence: To be ready to collaborate effectively with peers in order to achieve a common goal
To be ready to learn and apply new technologies independently
To be ready to exhibit the results of a collaborative work
To be ready to create and deliver rich web applications

projects.Title: 5 - Growing complexity
projects.Description:
Currently, the web is not only a place to visit websites but also for much more complex cases. Applications such as project management and design tools, media streaming, content management systems and chat systems are some examples of what can be created with HTML, CSS and Javascript. 

At the same time, web technologies no longer live merely in the browser, but can venture into the server side, the mobile applications development, the desktop and even into the microchips that start composing the Internet of Things.

All of this brings an unforeseen complexity to the web development ecosystem. In this Product Development Guide the students will create with tools that allow for a productive and manageable workflow in this context.

Skills.Skill: Be able to write a technical article

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is the Javascript Event Loops
Understand what is prototypal inheritance in Javascript

Skills.Skill: Be able to create a SPA with React
Be able to use an authentication mechanism in React
Be able to use a database in React
Be able to use a state management tool

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a Single Page Application
Understand what is a Router in Javascript

Skills.Skill: Be able to create a static site with React
Be able to use GraphQL to query data
Be able to create a Progresssive Web App
Be able to run performance checks and act on the results

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a Progressive Web App (PWA)

guides.Title: Javascript Beyond the Browser - Reactive Native

Skills.Skill: Be able to use React Native to create a mobile app

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a mobile application framework

Skills.Skill: Be able to create a Desktop application with Javascript
Be able to do market research related to web design

Competences.Competence: To be ready to collaborate effectively with peers in order to achieve a common goal
To be ready to learn and apply new technologies independently
To be ready to exhibit the results of a collaborative work
To be ready to create and deliver professional-grade web applications

projects.Title: 6 - Back-end & Infrastructure
projects.Description: In this project the students will get in touch with the back-end side of web development, understand what lies beyond the front-end coding and dive into the infrastructure that supports some of the most useful services front-end developers use on a regular basis.

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand the general aspects of how an Operating System works

Skills.Skill: Be able to navigate a Linux system
Be able to create, edit and remove files in a Linux system
Be able to execute commands in a Linux system

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand the general aspects of how Linux works

Skills.Skill: Be able to use the basics of Docker
Be able to write a technical article

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand the main concepts around security for web applications

Skills.Skill: Be able to create a NodeJS application
Be able to create an API with NodeJS
Be able to create an application using a NoSQL database

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is are the CRUD operations
Understand what is NoSQL and MongoDB

Skills.Skill: Be able to create an API using Python and Flask

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a RESTful API

Competences.Competence: To be ready to collaborate effectively with peers in order to achieve a common goal
To be ready to learn and apply new technologies independently
To be ready to exhibit the results of a collaborative work
To be ready to create and deliver professional-grade web applications
To be ready to communicate and work independent of the technology stack involved

projects.Title: 7 - Exploration
projects.Description: Since itâ€™s conception, the world of web development is ever-changing and evolving. This nature means it is important to be able to explore and learn its new capabilities in order to stay up-to-date as a professional. In this project the students explore multiple trending and promising topics in order to widen their view over established web development.

guides.Title: Further Exploration - The future of Design

Skills.Skill: Be able to draw a picture of what the future could look like in web design

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand the evolving nature of web design

guides.Title: Further Exploration - The future of Development

Skills.Skill: Be able to draw a picture of what the future could look like in web development

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand the evolving nature of web development

projects.Title: 8 - Internship
projects.Description: With all the knowledge and skills acquired so far the students are ready to have their first experience in the market as front-end developers. Partner companies propose possible projects and execute them in collaboration with the students.

Competences.Competence: To be ready to collaborate effectively with peers in order to achieve a common goal
To be ready to learn and apply new technologies independently
To be ready to exhibit the results of a collaborative work
To be ready to create and deliver professional-grade web applications
To be ready to communicate and work independent of the technology stack involved
To be ready to utilize technical knowledge and social skills to effectively understand problems to be solved in the real world and offer adequate solutions
